lines.gurmukhi: jYsy Pl PUlih lY jwie bn rwie pRiq krY AiBmwnu kho kYsy bin AwvY jI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Dhal Dhoolahi Lai Jaai Ban Raai Prati , Karai Abhimaanu Kaho Kaisay Bani Aavai Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as someone takes a handful of fruits and flowers to present it to the king of the jungle where fruits and flowers abound, and then feels proud of his present, how can he be liked?

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy mukqwhl smuMdiH idKwvY jwie bwr bwr hI srwhY soBw qau n pwvY jI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Moukataahal Samoundrahi Dikhaavai Jaai , Baar Baar Hee Saraahai Sobhaa Tau N Paavai Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as someone takes a handful of pearls to the treasure house of pearls-ocean, and praises his pearls again and again, he does not earn any appreciation.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy knI kMcn sumyr snmuK rwiK mn mY grbu krY bwvro khwvY jI
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Kanee Kanchan Soumayr Sanamoukh Raakhi , Man Mai Garabu Karai Baavaro Kahaavai Jee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as someone presents a small piece of gold nugget to Sumer mountain (the home of gold) and feels proud of his gold, he would be called a fool.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy igAwn iDAwn Twn pRwn dY rIJwieE cwhY pRwnpiq siqgur kYsy kY rIJwvY jI ]510]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Giaan Dhiaan Tthaan Praan Dai Reejhaaiao Chaahai , Praanapati Satigur Kaisay Kai Reejhaavai Jee ?510?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly if someone talks of knowledge and contemplations and pretends to surrender himself with a view to please and entice the True Guru, he cannot succeed in his nefarious designs of pleasing the True Guru the master of all life.  (510)
